title: Center of mass - bar of two materials

content.question: A <math alttext="24 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></math> long rectangular bar is composed of two uniform <math alttext="12 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></math> bars of different materials, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, with the same cross-sectional area as shown. The density of material <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is twice the density of material <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>. The long bar is cut through its center of mass and perpendicular to its long axis. What is the ratio of the mass of the left piece to the mass of the right piece?

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
